page.title: 05The eduction system in Elgin
page.content: From the age of 3 children may attend nursery schools which is a preperation for primary school.There are seven primary schools in Elgin which the children attend from an average age of 4 and a half.Through the parents charter it is possible to choose which school to attend.There is one Roman Catholic school,St Slyvesters and six primary school in Elgin;New Elgin, Greenwards, West end, East end, Bishopmill, and Seafield primaries.There are two Secondary Schools, Elgin High and Elgin Academy, each of which has about 800 pupils. They are both co-educational, 6th year secondary schools.From the secondary schools pupils can attend Moray Technical College which provides a vocational education.In both Secondary Schools, the college and the Community centre also an adult Education System.
